馗字的基本解释

馗
kuí
同“逵”。

馗字的汉语字典释义

[①]［kuí］
［《廣韻》渠追切，平脂，羣。］
同“逵1”。
四通八达的大路。
[②]［qiú］
［《廣韻》巨鳩切，平尤，羣。］
大菌。参见“馗2廚”。

馗字的康熙字典解释

【戌集下】【首字部】　馗； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页1428第03
【集韻】渠龜切，音逵。【正字通】頯頄?同。面頰骨也。　又【集韻】與逵同。【說文】?，九達道也。似龜背，故謂之?。?，高也，故从?。【六書故】爾雅，九達謂之逵。亦借作?。【字彙】古者涂方九軌，故从九首，一道爲一首。　又菌名。【爾雅·釋草】中?菌。【註】地蕈，似蓋，江東名土菌，亦曰?厨。【疏】大者名中?，小者名菌。　又鍾馗，人名。【正字通】人之名鍾馗者非一。宋禁中舊有吳道子所畫鍾馗，卷首唐人題云：明皇開元，講武驪山，還宮，上夢大鬼制小鬼，命吳道子畫之。熙寧五年，上令畫工摸搨，鋟版印賜兩府輔臣各一本，是歲除夜，遣內供奉官梁楷就東西府給賜鍾馗像。唐逸史載，明皇畫夢鬼藍袍，曰：臣終南山進士鍾馗，除天下虛耗之孽。詔吳道子畫之賜二府，其說未詳。後漢有李鍾馗，隋將有喬鍾馗，楊鍾馗，北史堯暄本名鍾馗，字辟邪。胡應麟筆叢曰：六朝已有鍾馗，後人附會爲作傅，如北史及唐人張鍾馗，諸取名者，皆以鬼神爲名也。據諸說，鍾馗之名，非始于開元也。　又椎亦名鍾馗。【周禮·冬官考工記

馗字的起名意思

四通八达的道路，也指“钟馗”传说中打鬼、捉鬼的神。

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
【戌集下】【First Word Department】　kui; Kangxi Strokes: 11; Page Number: Page 1428 Page 03
[Ji Yun] Qu turtle cut, sound Kui. 【Zhengzitong】The same. Cheek bones too.　[Jiyun] and Kui are the same. [Said the text]?, Jiu Dadao also. It is like a turtle back, so it is called?. ?, Gao Ye, so follow? [Six Books and Gu] Erya, Jiuda is called Zhikui. Also borrowed as?. [Vocabulary] The ancients painted nine tracks with squares, so from nine poems, one poem is one.　Also the name of the bacteria. [Erya Shicao] Chinese bacteria. [Note] Earth mushrooms, like caps, are famous soil mushrooms in Jiangdong, also called "cooking". 【Sparse】The big ones are in the middle? The small ones are the bacteria.　Zhong Kui again, name. [Zhengzitong] The name of Zhong Kui is not one. In the Song Dynasty, there was a Zhong Kui painted by Wu Daozi, and the front page of the book was written by the Tang Dynasty: Ming Emperor Kaiyuan, talked about Wulishan, returned to the palace, Shangmeng big ghost made little ghost, ordered Wu Daozi to paint it. In the five years of Xining, the painter Motuo was ordered, and a copy was given to each of the ministers of the two provinces. On the New Year's Eve, Liang Kai, an official enshrined in the interior, gave a portrait of Zhong Kui to the East and the West. In the history of Tang Yi, the Ming emperor painted the blue robe of the dream ghost and said: Zhong Kui, a jinshi in Nanshan, will eliminate the evil of the world. Zhao Wu Daozi's painting was bestowed on the Second Mansion, and its description is unclear. The Later Han Dynasty had Li Zhongkui, the Sui Dynasty would have Qiao Zhongkui, Yang Zhongkui, and Beishi Yaoxuan's real name was Zhongkui, with the word warding off evil. Hu Yinglin's series of writings said: Zhong Kui was already in the Six Dynasties, and later generations were attached as Fu, such as the Northern History and Zhang Zhongkui of the Tang Dynasty. All the names were named after ghosts and gods. According to Zhu said, Zhong Kui's name did not begin with Kaiyuan.　You Shii is also known as Zhong Kui. 【Zhou Li·Dongguan Kao Gong Ji
